Sequence Information.Peptide Name:
adevonin (Derived from Adenanthera pavonina trypsin inhibitor (ApTI))
inhibitor (ApTI))
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.30570384]Gram-positive bacteria :Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 80958 (MIC=7.35 μM);Gram-negative bacteria :Escherichia coli ATCC 35218 (MIC=7.35 μM), Klebsiella oxytoca ATCC 13182 (MIC=1.84 μM), Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 70603 (MIC=3.67 μM), Serratia marcesens ATCC 13880 (MIC=1.84 μM), Klebsiella pneumoniae KpC+ 001825971 (MIC=25.6 μM)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.30570384] 0% hemolysis at 43.75 μM , 72.5% hemolysis at 175 μM , 77% hemolysis at 350 μg/ml against human type O erythrocytes
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: [Ref.30570384] In fibroblasts, a significant reduction of cell viability, of 25% on average, is observed in each time interval(24,48 and 72h) in the highest peptide concentration(10 μM)
Sequence Information.Structure Description: Adevonin showed that its secondary structure varies according to the environment, acquiring
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against Gram-positive bacteria and Gram-negative bacteria

Literature.Title: Adevonin, a novel synthetic antimicrobial peptide designed from the Adenanthera pavonina trypsin inhibitor (ApTI) sequence
Literature.Author: Mayara S. Rodrigues, Caio F. R. de Oliveira, Luís H. O. Almeida, Simone M.Neto, Ana Paula A. Boleti, Edson L. dos Santos, Marlon H. Cardoso, Suzana,M. Ribeiro, Octávio L. Franco, Fernando S. Rodrigues, Alexandre J. Macedo,Flávia R. Brust & Maria Lígia R. Macedo
